result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

11:37 AM Defendant Tristan D. Plautz in court.  Attorney James Charles Koppelman Mr. in court for Tristan D. Plautz.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.  Waive reading of Information.  Plea of not guilty to the charge/charges.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

01:01 PM Attorney James Charles Koppelman in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waived further reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived freely and voluntarily.  Bond continued.   Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm. - rt
Initial appearance on April 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:45 AM Defendant Tristan D. Plautz in court with attorney Nicholas Grant Smith appeared specially.  Defendant Tristan D. Plautz in custody of Taylor County Jail.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Smith appeared via video.  Court takes judicial notice of Taylor Co. Case No. 22CF9.  Probable cause found.  Atty Tlusty requests $500.00 cash bond with conditions of:  booking; no contact with A.A.P. 04-26-1994; requests court to direct clerk to begin bond forfeiture proceedings on 22CF9.  Atty Smith objects to bond.   Court orders bond as requested and directs clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in 22CF9.  DE updated his telephone number. ba
